page.title: 15THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: RODINGTON VILLAGE SCHOOL HAS TWO CLASSROOMS. THE INFANTS HAVE A MOBILE CLASSROOM WHICH IS LIGHT AND AIRY. THE JUNIORS OCCUPY THE ORIGINAL BUILDING WHICH IS COOL AND DARK EVEN IN SUMMER AS THE WINDOWS ARE HIGH. THERE IS NO HALL SO THE SCHOOL USES THE VILLAGE HALL ONCE A WEEK FOR THEIR P.E. ALTHOUGH THERE IS A KITCHEN AND THE SCHOOL DINNERS ARE COOKED ON THE PREMISES, THERE IS NO DINING ROOM, SO THE CHILDREN CLEAR THEIR DESKS AND EAT THEIR MEAL IN THE JUNIOR CLASSSROOM. THE TOILETS ARE OUTSIDE THE MAIN BUILDING. THEY FROZE FOR SEVERAL DAYS THIS YEAR, SO THE SCHOOL HAD TO CLOSE. THERE IS A SMALL PLAYGROUND WHICH IS QUITE NARROW. THERE IS A HOUSE ATTACHED TO THE MAIN BUILDING. THIS USED TO BE THE SCHOOL HOUSE FOR THE USE OF THE HEAD TEACHER. IT IS NOW RENTED OUT.
